item.title: Clickety add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Richard Feynmann
item.description: "Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible." -- Richard Feynmann

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Religion is a culture of faith; science is a culture of doubt." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "I think it's much more interesting to live not knowing than to have answers which might be wrong." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Clickety add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michaelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all -- the apathy of human beings." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Instructions for living a life. Pay attention. Be astonished. Tell about it." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Zsa Zsa Gabor
item.description: "Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do. " -- Zsa Zsa Gabor

item.title: Clickety add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life isn't fair, it's just fairer than death, that's all." -- William Goldman

item.title: Clickety add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Who says life is fair, where is that written?" -- William Goldman

item.title: Clickety add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "And that's when she put her book down. And looked at me. And said it: "Life isn't fair, Bill. we tell our children that it is, but it's a terrible thing to do. It's not only a lie, it's a cruel lie. Life is not fair, and it never has been, and it's never going to be." -- William Goldman

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "If you are silent about your pain, they’ll kill you and say you enjoyed it." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Clickety add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You can present the material, but you can't make me care." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Clickety add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Her heart was a secret garden and the walls were very high." -- William Goldman
